defs: the first person or primeval being - a) Viṣṇu or Křṣṇa, b) Śiva, c) (Jain.) Ādijina..
the first or original type or model from which anything is copied; a prototype.
(vīr.) a devotee who has received or eligible for receiving, the divine kindness or favour from Śiva.
a kind of alliteration in which a sound, usu. of a consonant or a cluster of consonants, repeats at the beginning of each line of a poem or clause.
= ಆದಿಜಿನ.
= ಆದಿಜಿನ.
(myth.) Rudra, a Śaiva deity.
of or existing in or from the beginning or the earliest times or ages; original.

primitive - a) (biol.) designating or of an organism organ, etc. at the starting point of its evolutionary development or very little evolved from early ancestral types; b) (biol.) earliest formed in the development of an organism organ, structure, etc.; primordial.
he who belongs to the primitive age or early stages.
a man belonging to the earliest period of the history of mankind (i.e. of pre-historic period).
the time-tested way or manner of the wise-men of olden days.
(Śaiva) a person relieved from the burden of bondage of the soul in the mundane world.
= ಆದಿಜಿನ.
= ಆದಿಪುರುಷ.

that which is the cause for everything; first foundation; primeval cause.
the Supreme, as the first cause of the universe.
one of the scheduled castes.
(rhet.) yamaka (repetition of the same word or sound, having different meaning) that occurs at the beginning of a foot.
(geol.) the first geologic period in the Paleozoic Era, marked by a profusion of marine animals, esp. trilobites and brachiopods; the Cambrian era.
the first of the four ages of the world (lasting 17,28,000 years) (also called Křta or Satya yuga).
Sri Rangapaṭṭaṇa in Maṇḍya District of Karnāṭaka, the first of the three towns in the course of the river Kāvēri, which have Ranganātha shrines.
the first king - a) Přthu Manu; b) name of a king in Jaina mythology.
the plant Crataeva marmelos ( = Aegle marmelos) of Capparaceae family.
a variety in mango.
its fruit.
(vīr.) Rudra, considered to be the prime cause for the Trinities.
an epithet of Goddess Lakṣmi, the consort of Viṣṇu.
(vīr.) the Liŋga (the phallus-like form of Śiva) believed to be the prime cause for the birth, maintenance and destruction of the universe.
(mus.) a mode derivative of the main mode Simhēndramadhyama.
(mus.) a mode derivative of the main mode Pavani.
the Supreme Being.
the first day of the week; Sunday.

the original divine power of the cosmos; the primeval spiritual energy; Goddess Durga.

the first poet - a) Brahma, who is supposed to have produced and promulgated the Vedas; b) Vālmīki, considered as the first to show other Samskřta poets, 'the path of poetry', c) Pampa, the first recognised poet, with his immortal and unsurpassed Kannaḍa classical works 'Vikramārjuna Vijaya' and ' Ādipurāṇa'.
Rāmāyaṇa, by Vālmīki, acknowledged as the first poem in Samskřta language.
Vikramārjuna Vijaya of Pampa which is the first Kannaḍa classical work.

hereditary - a) of or passed down by, heredity; designating or of a characteristic transmitted genetically from generation to generation; b) of or passed down by, inheritance from an ancestor to a legal heir; ancestral; or having title, right, etc. by inheritance.
= ಆನುವಂಶ.

heredity - a) the transmission of characteristics from parent to offspring by means of genes in the chromosomes b) the tendency of offspring to resemble parents or ancestors through such transmission.
(biol.) the evolutionary development of a species or other group of organisms through a succession of forms; phylogenesis.
the evolutionary development of a particular (esp. anatomical) feature of an organism; phylogenesis.
that which has been handed down form generation to generation; a tradition.
= ಆನುವಂಶ.
= ಆನುವಂಶಿಕತೆ.
according to hearing or resting on, tradition.
that which is performed as a traditional ritual, believed to be a means of obtaining heaven or absolution.
he who performs the rituals, including sacrifices, as per the Vēdas.

incidental; concomitant - a) liable to happen to; naturally attaching to; b) occurring as something casual or of secondary importance; not directly relevant to; following (up)on as a subordinate circumstance; c) of an expense or charge: incurred apart from the main sum disbursed.
following as an effect or inference; consequential.
(usu. in pl.) those minerals whose presence or absence is not regarded in naming a rock; accessory minerals.
the quality or fact of being incidental or concomitant.
a benefit derived incidentally, which was not aimed at.
something additional to regular profit or pay, resulting from one's position or employment, esp. something customary or expected; perquisite.
containing or full of water; watery; marshy; wet.
any animal that frequents marshy places, (such as a buffalo).
a watery or marshy place.
a watery or marshy place.
absence of cruelty or atrociousness; hence a) mildness; b) kindness; c) compassion; pity; mercy.

any of the huge, thick-skinned, almost hairless mammals of Proboscidea order, being the largest of extant four-footed animals, having a long, flexible snout (called a trunk) and, usually, two ivory tusks growing out of the upper jaw, of which Alphas maximus, theIndian elephant is commonly domesticated the other being Loxodonta africana, the African elephant.
(used fig.) the quality or state of being large; largeness; something huge.

ಬಿಳಿ ಆನೆ biḷi āne something from which little profit or use is derived but which needs to be maintained at much expense; a white elephant; ಆನೆ ಇದ್ದರೂ ಸಾವಿರ, ಸತ್ತರೂ ಸಾವಿರ āne iddarū sāvira, sattarū sāvira great things have value always, i.e. both during their life time and after death too; ಆನೆಯ ಕೈಲಿ ಕಬ್ಬುಕೊಟ್ಟ ಹಾಗೆ āneya kaili kabbukoṭṭa hāge as irrecoverable as a lump of butter in a greyhound's mouth; ಆನೆ ಕೆಳಗೆ ಬಿದ್ದರೂ ಆಳುದ್ದ āne kēḷage biddarū āḷudda do not take the great man lightly even when he has fallen down; ಆನೆಗೂ ಅಡಿ ತಪ್ಪೀತು ānegū aḍi tappītu even great men falter; ಆನೆ ತಿಂಬೋದು ಸೊಪ್ಪು, ಇರುವೆ ತಿಂಬೋದು ಸಕ್ಕರೆ āne timbōdu soppu, iruve timbōdu sakkare what one enjoys depends on his or her ability to digest, rather than on his or her social status; ಆನೆ ನುಂಗಿದ ಬೇಲದ ಕಾಯಿಯ ಹಾಗೆ āne nuŋgida bēlada kāyiya hāge that which is consumed or wasted without being seen outwardly so; ಆನೆ ಬೆಂಡಾದರೆ ಕೊಟ್ಟಿಗೆ ಹೊಕ್ಕೀತೆ āne beṇḍādare koṭṭige hokkīte? a person of dignity, may lose his wealth, but not his respect; ಆನೆ ಭಾರ ಆನೆಗೆ, ಇರುವೆ ಭಾರ ಇರುವೆಗೆ āne bhāra ānege, iruve bhāra iruvege no one knows the weight of another's burden; ಆನೆ ಮೇಲೆ ಹೋಗುವವನನ್ನು ಸುಣ್ಣ ಕೇಳಿದ ಹಾಗೆ āne mēle hōguvanannu suṇṇa kēḷida hāge (simile) it is like begging a worthless needle from an emperor;ಆನೆಯ ಗರ್ಭ āneya garbha the pregnancy of an elephant; 2. (fig.) any development, plan, implementation of which takes unduly long time; a tediously long period of endeavour before actual realisation; ಆನೆ ಸಾಧುವಾದರೆ ಅಗಸ ಮೈಲಿಗೆ ಹೇರಿದ āne sādhuvādare agasa maīlige hērida the willing horse is always worked to death; ಆನೆಬಿಟ್ಟು ಅಂಕುಶಕ್ಕೆ ಹೊಡೆದಾಡಿದ ಹಾಗೆ āne biṭṭu aŋkuśakke hoḍedāḍidaru to be extremely careful about small amounts of money and not careful enough about larger amounts of money; to be penny-wise and pound foolish; ಆನೆಯೇ ಹೋಗುವಾಗ ಬಾಲಕ್ಕೆ ಬಡಿದಾಡಿದರು ānēyē hōguvāga bālakke baḍidāḍidaru = ಆನೆ ಬಿಟ್ಟು ಅಂಕುಶಕ್ಕೆ ಹೊಡೆದಾಡಿದ ಹಾಗೆ; ಆನೆಯಾದರೂ ಸೊಪ್ಪು ಮೇಯೋದು ತಪ್ಪಲಿಲ್ಲ āneyādaru soppu mēyōdu tappalilla one can have only that which he is destined, irrespective of his rank or status; ಆನೆಯನ್ನು ನುಂಗುವವನಿಗೆ ಆಳು ಯಾವ ಲೆಕ್ಕ āneyannu nuŋguvavanige āḷu yāva lekka does he, who can move the mountain, care a fly; ಆನೆಯ ಮೇಲೆ ಕೂತವನನ್ನು ನಾಯಿ ಏನುಮಾಡುತ್ತದೆ? āneya mēle kūtavanannu nāyi ēnu māḍuttade? bark not when you cannot bite; ಆನೆಹೋದ ದಾರಿಯಲ್ಲಿ ಇರುವೆ ಹೋಗಬಲ್ಲುದು, ಇರುವೆ ಹೋದ ದಾರಿಯಲ್ಲಿ ಇರುವೆ ಹೋಗಲಾಗದು āne hōda dāriyalli iruve hōgabahudu, iruve hōda dāriyalli āne hōgalāgadu humility survives all odds.
= ಆನೆಗಂಭ.
a kind of scab, a contagious skin disease, characterised by large, inflamed, painful, pus-filled swellings or boils.
the plant Agave americana of Agavaceae family; demon aloe; century plant.
the plant Agave sisalana of Agavaceae family; sisal hemp.
(pl.) rounded pieces of ice that are larger than 5 mm and sometimes fall during thunderstorms; frozen raindrops; hailstones.
a small stone pieces with round, and smooth surface, tossed from the back of, and held by the palm, in a children's play.

a chronic disease characterised by the enlargement of the legs, and by the hardening and ulceration of the surrounding skin, caused by obstruction of the lymphatic vessels, often due to infestation by filarial worms; elephantiasis.
the composite plant, Elephantopus scaber of Asteraceae family; elephant's foot.
(obs.) an ancient copper coin of very small value, bearing the figure of an elephant.
a tropical plant, Begonia cardifolia of Begoniaceae family, cultivated for their remarkable leaves; elephant's ear; begonia.
= ಆನೆಕಾಲು.
a variety in paddy, that yields relatively longer rice.
a pest, silver shoot fly, destructive of paddy plant.
a kind of plant.
a post for tethering the elephants.
a stout and heavy wooden pole used as a prop for supporting a wall.
= ಆನೆಕಜ್ಜಿ.
the plant Urtica parviflora of Urticaceae family.
= ಆನೆಗದುಗು.
= ಆನೆಗದುಗು.
the plant, Cassia tora of Caesalpiniaceae family; ring worm plant.
a herd of elephants.
= ಆನೆಗಲ್ಲು.
a large boulder.
a catching of an elephant (for purpose of domesticating).
the destruction caused by an elephant (as in a sugar-cane field or in a potter's workshop).
any catch of high value or importance.
a ruthless robbing of helpless by a heinous ruler or invader.
to catch a person or a thing, by trapping, like catching an elephant by making him fall into a trench.
to rob or plunder ruthlessly.
an elephant driver.
a trainer of elephants.
the plant, Adenanthera pavonia of Caesalpinaceae family; red-wood tree; coral pea; bead tree.
an elephant-killer.
the lion, as the destroyer of elephants.
